_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The sense-fields that one will not exper: The eye itself and those sights
The ear itself and those sounds
The nose itself and those smells
The tongue itself and those tastes
The body itself and those touches
The perceptions of a mendicant who doesn: Going totally beyond perceptions of form
With the ending of perceptions of impingement
Not focusing on perceptions of diversity
Aware that 'space is infinite', enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space
Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space
Aware that 'consciousness is infinite', enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness
Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness
Aware that 'there is nothing at all', enters and remains in the dimension of nothingness
The fruit of the immersion that does not: The fruit of this immersion is enlightenment.
